recyclable_percentage_description: Ecoustic Weave panels can be recycled through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme either on-site or through one of our local third-party recycling partners: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: Ecoustic Weave panels can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recycled_content_description: SCS Certified 60% Post-Consumer Recycled Polyester Staple Fiber Content
recycling_process_description: 100% PET (polyethylene terephthalate) is a mono-material that can be mechanically recycled into pellets or flakes for use in textiles, carpets, and nonwoven materials, or moulded into containers and packaging strapping. It can also be chemically recycled and repolymerised into food-grade PET resin for bottles, containers, or high-quality textile fibres comparable to virgin PET. Australia currently lacks commercial-scale chemical reprocessing facilities for plastics, however, so most PET is downcycled into lower-grade composite materials (e.g. foam).
reusable_description: Ecoustic Weave panels are designed for easy, quick installation + disassembly, and can be reused as they do not require adhesive or permanent fixtures. They can be mounted to a surface using either an aluminium frame system, or a concealed screw and batten system. This allows for easy separation of materials at end of product lifecycle.
end_of_life_program_description: Ecoustic Weave panels can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Water is not used in the manufacturing of this product.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Consolidated shipments, efficient packing and optimised routes are all employed to reduce emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: Waste, environmental impact and cost can be minimised by designing with substrate panel size in mind. Refer to the brochure for assembly options, ensure to provide a plan for installation, and contact the Instyle Ecoustic team for CAD drawings.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights risks in PET supply chains arise mainly in the polymer processing stage, where workers can be exposed to harmful VOCs and antimony, a toxic substance used as a catalyst. These conditions necessitate stringent safety measures to protect workers' health and rights. All of Instyle's Ecoustic SC products are free of such risks, as qualified by their Declare and Cradle to Cradle certifications.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Acoustic PET panels can release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. This can be mitigated by returning the product to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
specific_installation_methods: Ecoustic Weave panels are designed for easy, quick installation + disassembly, and can be reused as they do not require adhesive or permanent fixtures. They can be mounted to a surface using either an aluminium frame system, or a concealed screw and batten system. This allows for easy separation of materials at end of product lifecycle. Follow the accompanying installation + care guides for installation guidelines that maximise end of life disassembly.
other_comments: Please note that kgCO2eq value varies depending panel thicknesses – an average has been provided. Refer to EPD for full breakdown. Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

product_description: A high-performance textile with a versatile, contemporary multicolour boucle texture

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems

recyclable_percentage_description: All of Instyle's pure wool LIFE Textiles are inherently renewable, recyclable and biodegradable. They can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: LIFE Textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
recycling_process_description: Wool textiles can be shredded and either re-spun into blended yarns in a textile-to-textile recycling process, or downcycled into lower grade aggregate products.
end_of_life_program_description: High-performance textiles can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme, however conditions of return apply for these materials as there is currently limited recycling capability for bonded and PU-backed textiles in Australia. Visit https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/ for more information.
water_reduction_techniques: Manufacturing facilities use a mix of rain-fed and recirculated water.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any textile, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise fabric usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the textile and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_action_plan_comment: Communicating directly with the supplier to establish Corrective Action Plans that focused on implementing processes and procedures, retraining staff, and establishing policies so that all risks, low to high, can be monitored, responded to and eliminated.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks can be prevalent in synthetic textile supply chains, often involving exploitative labour practices and poor working conditions in countries with weak labour laws. Additionally, there are risks of toxic chemical use, environmental pollution, and reliance on fossil fuels. Our manufacturer operates under strict labour regulations and adheres to high social & environmental standards, ensuring fair treatment of workers and reducing these risks significantly.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: While high-performance textiles offer durability, versatility and longevity, they require management to reduce risks throughout their lifecycle. Instyle's manufacturer is REACH, RoHS + Bluesign compliant, however high-performance textiles can still release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. Instyle is working on developing responsible recirculation pathways for these textiles through our REVIVE product stewardship scheme to help mitigate these potential impacts.
specific_installation_methods: Avoiding direct adhesive application to backing foam makes high-performance textiles more suitable for end-of-life stewardship. Ideally, these textiles should be reused as part of the original furnishing structure to maximise their lifespan and sustainability.
other_comments:
Instyle's reduced toxicity formulation for high-performance textiles ensures these products are free from PFAS, PFCs, phthalates, flame retardants, anti-bacterial additives, lead, BPA, TRIS, and formaldehyde, and do not contain conflict minerals. They meet international environmental, health, and safety standards, including California Prop 65, CPSIA, and REACH. This is supported by our manufacturer’s ISO 14001-certified Environmental Management System.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

recycling_process_description: 100% polyester is a mono-material that can be mechanically recycled into pellets or flakes for use in textiles, carpets, and nonwoven materials, or moulded into containers and packaging strapping. It can also be chemically recycled and repolymerised into food-grade PET resin for bottles, containers, or high-quality textile fibres comparable to virgin polyester. Australia’s commercial-scale chemical reprocessing facilities for 100% polyester textiles are limited; however, Instyle's third-party partners can process this waste, ensuring it is diverted from landfill and repurposed into valuable materials.

water_reduction_techniques: Unknown
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Textile weaving is done by LoomTex in Geelong, and the distance from the final manufacturing stage to the port is under 15km, both of which significantly minimise transport emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any textile, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise fabric usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the textile and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_action_plan_comment: Communicating directly with the supplier to establish Corrective Action Plans that focused on implementing processes and procedures, retraining staff, and establishing policies so that all risks, low to high, can be monitored, responded to and eliminated.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks can be prevalent in synthetic textile supply chains, often involving exploitative labour practices and poor working conditions in countries with weak labour laws. Additionally, there are risks of toxic chemical use, environmental pollution, and reliance on fossil fuels. However, these risks are low in Australia due to strict labour laws and regulations ensuring fair treatment and wages for workers.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Polyester textiles can release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. This can be mitigated by returning the product to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
other_comments: Think Plus is made locally in Australia, minimising transport kilometres. Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

compliance_requirements.rating: Ignitability 9, Flame Spread 0, Heat Evolved 1, Smoke Developed 4

type_of_packaging: Our circular packaging strategy for textiles uses high percentage recycled cardboard, reusable pallets, and recycled paper. We continuously reduce polymer use, currently limited only to tapes and necessary bagging where no viable sustainable alternative exists.

product_description: A an exquisite, sturdy European semi-aniline upholstery leather perfect for public areas

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems

recyclable_percentage_description: All of Instyle's pure wool LIFE Textiles are inherently renewable, recyclable and biodegradable. They can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: Leathers can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recycling_process_description: Wool textiles can be shredded and either re-spun into blended yarns in a textile-to-textile recycling process, or downcycled into lower grade aggregate products.
end_of_life_program_description: Leathers can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Tannery uses a biological Water Treatment Plant, utilising 100% non-potable river water in a closed-loop process that purifies the water before returning it to the source.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: No specific policies are in place to reduce transport emissions, however all hides are sourced regionally in Europe and processing is in a vertical facility which significantly reduces transport distance between hubs.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any leather, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise hide usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the leather and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_action_plan_comment: Communicating directly with the supplier to establish Corrective Action Plans that focused on implementing processes and procedures, retraining staff, and establishing policies so that all risks, low to high, can be monitored, responded to and eliminated.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks are significant concerns in the leather supply chain, often involving exploitative labour practices and poor working conditions in countries with weak labor laws. The Leather Working Group (LWG) provides a framework for auditing and certifying tanneries based on their adherence to social and environmental standards, helping to ensure responsible sourcing and production practices. By requiring compliance with strict labour regulations and environmental policies, LWG certifications provide assurances of fair treatment for workers and efforts to mitigate toxic chemical use and environmental pollution. As global leaders in sustainable leather production, our European partner Elmo sets high standards to actively reducing risks and promote safe practices throughout the leather supply chain.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: While soft furnishing PVC materials offer durability, versatility and longevity, they require management to reduce risks throughout their lifecycle. Instyle's manufacturer is REACH, RoHS + Bluesign compliant, however vinyls can still produce harmful emissions during manufacturing. Instyle is working on developing responsible recirculation pathways through our REVIVE product stewardship scheme to help mitigate potential environmental impacts at end-of-life.
specific_installation_methods: Avoiding any direct adhesive application to backing foam makes leathers more suitable for end-of-life stewardship. Ideally, leathers should be reused as part of the original furnishing structure to maximise their lifespan and sustainability.
other_comments:
Elmo prioritises sustainability through several significant initiatives. Their "Zero Waste Leather" concept ensures that all production waste is upcycled, recycled, or reused, creating a circular economy with no waste sent to landfills. The Elmo Circular Operating model (ECO) enhances resource efficiency and reduces environmental impact by repurposing all process waste as raw materials or energy sources. Elmo has achieved CO2 neutrality in energy use by utilising 100% renewable electricity and biofuel-based steam for heating. They enhance sustainability further by implementing a circular heating energy approach, selling back the hot condensate generated from biofuel steam to the heating supplier, which reduces energy consumption in steam production. For more detailed information, visit their website.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

They can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: Leathers can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recycling_process_description: Wool textiles can be shredded and either re-spun into blended yarns in a textile-to-textile recycling process, or downcycled into lower grade aggregate products.
end_of_life_program_description: Leathers can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Tannery uses 100% non-potable water and has water reduction measures in place. ISO 14001 certification ensures tanneries manage water use by implementing controls for efficient consumption, monitoring discharge, complying with local water regulations and continuously improving practices.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: No specific policies are in place to reduce transport emissions, however all hides are sourced regionally in Europe and processing is in a vertical facility which significantly reduces transport distance between hubs.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any leather, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise hide usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the leather and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_action_plan_comment: Communicating directly with the supplier to establish Corrective Action Plans that focused on implementing processes and procedures, retraining staff, and establishing policies so that all risks, low to high, can be monitored, responded to and eliminated.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks are significant concerns in the leather supply chain, often involving exploitative labour practices and poor working conditions in countries with weak labor laws. The Leather Working Group (LWG) provides a framework for auditing and certifying tanneries based on their adherence to social and environmental standards, helping to ensure responsible sourcing and production practices. By requiring compliance with strict labour regulations and environmental policies, LWG certifications provide assurances of fair treatment for workers and efforts to mitigate toxic chemical use and environmental pollution. Our European leather partners set high standards to actively reduce risks and promote safe practices throughout the leather supply chain.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: While soft furnishing PVC materials offer durability, versatility and longevity, they require management to reduce risks throughout their lifecycle. Instyle's manufacturer is REACH, RoHS + Bluesign compliant, however vinyls can still produce harmful emissions during manufacturing. Instyle is working on developing responsible recirculation pathways through our REVIVE product stewardship scheme to help mitigate potential environmental impacts at end-of-life.
specific_installation_methods: Avoiding any direct adhesive application to backing foam makes leathers more suitable for end-of-life stewardship. Ideally, leathers should be reused as part of the original furnishing structure to maximise their lifespan and sustainability.
other_comments: Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

recyclable_percentage_description: Ecoustic Curve can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/ (product must be free of adhesives, hardware and contaminants)
recyclable_offcuts_description: Ecoustic Curve offcuts can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
recycling_process_description: 100% PET (polyethylene terephthalate) is a mono-material that can be mechanically recycled into pellets or flakes for use in textiles, carpets, and nonwoven materials, or moulded into containers and packaging strapping. It can also be chemically recycled and repolymerised into food-grade PET resin for bottles, containers, or high-quality textile fibres comparable to virgin PET. Australia currently lacks commercial-scale chemical reprocessing facilities for plastics, however, so most PET is downcycled into lower-grade composite materials (e.g. foam).
reusable_description: Ecoustic Curve is not designed for disassembly; however, it still aligns with Instyle’s commitment to material efficiency. Unlike our other Ecoustic panels, which can be installed with aluminium and cable hardware to minimise adhesive use, Ecoustic Curve generally requires adhesive-based installation. Please check the terms of Instyle's REVIVE® product stewardship scheme for takeback applicability.
end_of_life_program_description: Ecoustic Curve can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/ (product must be free of adhesives, hardware and contaminants)
water_reduction_techniques: Water is not used in the manufacturing of this product.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: The A4 module is not declared, however local manufacturing, consolidated shipments, efficient packing and optimised routes are all employed to reduce emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: Waste, environmental impact and cost can be minimised by designing with roll size in mind. It is advisable to design components in dimensions that maximise the yield of both roll width and length. The Instyle Ecoustic design team can help with efficient yield component sizes for our panel products using Ecoustic Curve.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights risks in PET supply chains arise mainly in the polymer processing stage, where workers can be exposed to harmful VOCs and antimony, a toxic substance used as a catalyst. These conditions necessitate stringent safety measures to protect workers' health and rights. These risks are minimised due to strict Australia labour laws, and as qualified by the product's Declare and Global Greentag Level A certifications.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Acoustic PET panels can release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. This can be mitigated by returning the product to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
specific_installation_methods: coustic Curve is not designed for disassembly; however, it still aligns with Instyle’s commitment to material efficiency. Unlike our other Ecoustic panels, which can be installed with aluminium and cable hardware to minimise adhesive use, Ecoustic Curve generally requires adhesive-based installation. Please check the terms of Instyle's REVIVE® product stewardship scheme for takeback applicability. Follow the accompanying installation + care guides for installation guidelines that maximise product longevity.
other_comments: Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

recyclable_offcuts_description: Ecoustic panel offcuts can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.

recycling_process_description: 100% PET (polyethylene terephthalate) is a mono-material that can be mechanically recycled into pellets or flakes for use in textiles, carpets, and nonwoven materials, or moulded into containers and packaging strapping. It can also be chemically recycled and repolymerised into food-grade PET resin for bottles, containers, or high-quality textile fibres comparable to virgin PET. Australia currently lacks commercial-scale chemical reprocessing facilities for plastics, however, so most PET is downcycled into lower-grade composite materials (e.g. foam).
reusable_description: Ecoustic SC Workstation panels are designed for disassembly and improved dematerialisation. Our panels can be installed using Instyle’s intuitive natural anodised aluminium edging profiles, which reduce the need for adhesive and allow for easier separation of materials at end of product lifecycle.
end_of_life_program_description: Ecoustic panels can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Designs are screenprinted using non-hazardous , water-based GOTS-certified Permaset inks. These formulations reduce potable water use as they require less water for washing and involve recycling and treating water to minimise fresh water demand. Water is not used in the manufacturing of panel substrate.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Consolidated shipments, efficient packing and optimised routes are all employed to reduce emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: Waste, environmental impact and cost can be minimised by designing with panel size in mind. For example, if the panel is 1200mm x 2700mm, it is advisable to design components in widths like 300, 400, 600, or 1200mm. The Instyle Ecoustic design team can help with efficient yield component sizes for our panel products.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights risks in PET supply chains arise mainly in the polymer processing stage, where workers can be exposed to harmful VOCs and antimony, a toxic substance used as a catalyst. These conditions necessitate stringent safety measures to protect workers' health and rights. All of Instyle's Ecoustic SC products are free of such risks, as qualified by their Declare and Cradle to Cradle certifications.

specific_installation_methods: Ecoustic SC Workstation panels are designed for disassembly and improved dematerialisation. Our panels can be installed using Instyle’s intuitive natural anodised aluminium edging profiles, which reduce the need for adhesive and allow for easier separation of materials at end of product lifecycle. The packaging is placed on roller conveyors, through which it is hooded by applying a suitable cap and then conveyed to the oven for the application of shrink film.

product_description: A hanging screen system for enhanced acoustic + visual privacy, available in 5 timeless designs

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems

standard_dimensions: Thickness: Solid 12/24mm, Felt 12mm. Dimensions: 1200mm width, lengths 2100, 2400, 2700mm. Custom sizes available.
recyclable_percentage_description: Ecoustic Hang Ups can be recycled through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme either on-site or through one of our local third-party recycling partners: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: Ecoustic Hang Ups can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recycled_content_description: SCS Certified up to 60% Post-Consumer Recycled Polyester Staple Fiber Content
recycling_process_description: 100% PET (polyethylene terephthalate) is a mono-material that can be mechanically recycled into pellets or flakes for use in textiles, carpets, and nonwoven materials, or moulded into containers and packaging strapping. It can also be chemically recycled and repolymerised into food-grade PET resin for bottles, containers, or high-quality textile fibres comparable to virgin PET. Australia currently lacks commercial-scale chemical reprocessing facilities for plastics, however, so most PET is downcycled into lower-grade composite materials (e.g. foam).
reusable_description: Ecoustic Hang Ups are designed for easy, quick installation and disassembly. Instyle's intuitive anodised aluminium cable suspension system offers versatile installation options suited to any interior space. These adhesive-free suspension systems enable easy material separation at end of product lifecycle.
end_of_life_program_description: Ecoustic Baffle can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Water is not used in the manufacturing of this product.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Consolidated shipments, efficient packing and optimised routes are all employed to reduce emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: Waste, environmental impact and cost can be minimised by designing with substrate maximum dimensions in mind. Ecoustic Hang Ups can be fabricated to client specifications in 1200mm width and 2100mm, 2400mm + 2700mm lengths. Refer to the brochure to understand the various design and mounting options, ensure to provide a plan for installation, and contact the Instyle Ecoustic team for guidance on maximising yield to reduce offcut waste.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights risks in PET supply chains arise mainly in the polymer processing stage, where workers can be exposed to harmful VOCs and antimony, a toxic substance used as a catalyst. These conditions necessitate stringent safety measures to protect workers' health and rights. All of Instyle's Ecoustic SC + Felt products are free of such risks, as qualified by their Declare, Cradle to Cradle and Global Greentag Level A certifications.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Acoustic PET panels can release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. This can be mitigated by returning the product to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
specific_installation_methods: Ecoustic Hang Ups are designed for easy, quick installation and disassembly. Instyle's intuitive anodised aluminium cable suspension system offers versatile installation options suited to any interior space. These adhesive-free suspension systems enable easy material separation at end of product lifecycle. Follow the accompanying installation + care guides for installation guidelines that maximise end of life disassembly.
other_comments:
Ecoustic® Hang Ups are available in five versatile screen designs or can be customised to suit any interior space, achieving superior acoustic performance and ideal for various settings. Made from either Ecoustic® Solid Colour or Ecoustic® Felt Screen panels, they offer flexibility in both acoustic performance and aesthetics. Ecoustic® Solid Colour features a uniform exposed profile edge and comes in up to 21 colours, while Ecoustic® Felt Screen is laminated with felt on both sides of a white or black core, providing a subtle or contrasting profile detail in 34 colour options.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
Please note that kgCO2eq value varies depending panel thicknesses – an average has been provided. Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.
type_of_packaging: Our circular packaging strategy for Ecoustic products uses 84% recycled cardboard, reusable pallets, and recycled paper. We continuously reduce polymer use, currently limited only to tapes and necessary bagging where no viable sustainable alternative exists.

product_description: An acoustic panel with a bold large-scale design, echoing man-made forms + tension through structure

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems

standard_dimensions: 8mm* 13.5mm*, 25mm*, 50mm* + Ecoustic Screen 12mm* (*MOQs apply)/Print size: Panel 1200x2700mm, Screen 1200x2400mm appro
recyclable_percentage_description: Ecoustic panels can be recycled through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme either on-site or through one of our local third-party recycling partners: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: Ecoustic panel offcuts can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
recycling_process_description: 100% PET (polyethylene terephthalate) is a mono-material that can be mechanically recycled into pellets or flakes for use in textiles, carpets, and nonwoven materials, or moulded into containers and packaging strapping. It can also be chemically recycled and repolymerised into food-grade PET resin for bottles, containers, or high-quality textile fibres comparable to virgin PET. Australia currently lacks commercial-scale chemical reprocessing facilities for plastics, however, so most PET is downcycled into lower-grade composite materials (e.g. foam).
reusable_description: Ecoustic panels are designed for improved dematerialisation. Our panels can be installed using Instyle’s intuitive natural anodised aluminium edging profiles, which reduce the need for excess adhesive and allow for easier separation of materials at end of product lifecycle.
end_of_life_program_description: Ecoustic panels can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Designs are screenprinted using non-hazardous , water-based GOTS-certified Permaset inks. These formulations reduce potable water use as they require less water for washing and involve recycling and treating water to minimise fresh water demand. Water is not used in the manufacturing of panel substrate.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: The A4 module is not declared, however local manufacturing, consolidated shipments, efficient packing and optimised routes are all employed to reduce emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: Waste, environmental impact and cost can be minimised by designing with panel size in mind. For example, if the panel is 1200mm x 2700mm, it is advisable to design components in widths like 300, 400, 600, or 1200mm. The Instyle Ecoustic design team can help with efficient yield component sizes for our panel products.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights risks in PET supply chains arise mainly in the polymer processing stage, where workers can be exposed to harmful VOCs and antimony, a toxic substance used as a catalyst. These conditions necessitate stringent safety measures to protect workers' health and rights. These risks are minimised due to strict Australia labour laws, and as qualified by the product's Declare and Global Greentag Level A certifications.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Acoustic PET panels can release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. This can be mitigated by returning the product to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
specific_installation_methods: Ecoustic panels are designed for improved dematerialisation. Our panels can be installed using Instyle’s intuitive natural anodised aluminium edging profiles, which reduce the need for excess adhesive and allow for easier separation of materials at end of product lifecycle. Follow the accompanying installation + care guides for installation guidelines that maximise product longevity.
other_comments: Please note that kgCO2eq value varies depending panel thicknesses – an average has been provided. Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.
type_of_packaging: Our circular packaging strategy for Ecoustic products uses 84% recycled cardboard, reusable pallets, and recycled paper. We continuously reduce polymer use, currently limited only to tapes and necessary bagging where no viable sustainable alternative exists.

minimisation_design_strategy: Waste, environmental impact and cost can be minimised by designing with panel size in mind. For example, if the panel is 1200mm x 2700mm, it is advisable to design components in widths like 300, 400, 600, or 1200mm. The Instyle Ecoustic design team can help with efficient yield component sizes for our panel products.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights risks in PET supply chains arise mainly in the polymer processing stage, where workers can be exposed to harmful VOCs and antimony, a toxic substance used as a catalyst. These conditions necessitate stringent safety measures to protect workers' health and rights. These risks are minimised due to strict Australia labour laws, and as qualified by the product's Declare and Global Greentag Level A certifications.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Acoustic PET panels can release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. This can be mitigated by returning the product to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
specific_installation_methods: Ecoustic panels are designed for improved dematerialisation. Our panels can be installed using Instyle’s intuitive natural anodised aluminium edging profiles, which reduce the need for excess adhesive and allow for easier separation of materials at end of product lifecycle. Follow the accompanying installation + care guides for installation guidelines that maximise product longevity.
other_comments: Please note that kgCO2eq value varies depending panel thicknesses – an average has been provided. Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.
type_of_packaging: Our circular packaging strategy for Ecoustic products uses 84% recycled cardboard, reusable pallets, and recycled paper. We continuously reduce polymer use, currently limited only to tapes and necessary bagging where no viable sustainable alternative exists.

recyclable_percentage_description: Ecoustic panels can be recycled through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme either on-site or through one of our local third-party recycling partners: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: Ecoustic panel offcuts can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
recycling_process_description: 100% PET (polyethylene terephthalate) is a mono-material that can be mechanically recycled into pellets or flakes for use in textiles, carpets, and nonwoven materials, or moulded into containers and packaging strapping. It can also be chemically recycled and repolymerised into food-grade PET resin for bottles, containers, or high-quality textile fibres comparable to virgin PET. Australia currently lacks commercial-scale chemical reprocessing facilities for plastics, however, so most PET is downcycled into lower-grade composite materials (e.g. foam).

recyclable_offcuts_description: Offcuts can be returned to Armstrong to be recycled.
recycling_process_description: Post Consumer vinyl can be palletised and recycled for use in the manufacturing of new Armstrong products
end_of_life_program_description: Armstrong Flooring manufactures its products in Australia and uses its facilities to take back used material to be reworked and recycled into new Vinyl flooring. Armstrong Flooring is also a founding member of the ResiLoop Program based in Australia.
water_reduction_techniques: Yes
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Trucks are run at 85% full loads and Backloading is utilised where possible
minimisation_design_strategy: Sheet vinyl should be set out in a way that allows for the highest yield of the material required.
factory_finished_description: Polyurethane re-enforced (PUR)
specific_installation_methods: Product to be cleanly uplifted for recycling.

product_description: A beautiful semi-aniline European leather with an elegant, hand-tipped, shagreen-like texture

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems

recyclable_percentage_description: All of Instyle's pure wool LIFE Textiles are inherently renewable, recyclable and biodegradable. They can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: Leathers can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recycling_process_description: Wool textiles can be shredded and either re-spun into blended yarns in a textile-to-textile recycling process, or downcycled into lower grade aggregate products.
end_of_life_program_description: Leathers can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Tannery complies with the stringent requirements and high standards set forth by EU legislation regarding water consumption and other resource use. No specific measures are in place for capturing rainwater or recycled water.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: No specific policies are in place to reduce transport emissions, however all hides are both sourced and processed in Western Europe, which significantly reduces the need for air and sea transport between hubs.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any leather, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise hide usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the leather and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_action_plan_comment: Communicating directly with the supplier to establish Corrective Action Plans that focused on implementing processes and procedures, retraining staff, and establishing policies so that all risks, low to high, can be monitored, responded to and eliminated.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks are major concerns in global leather supply chains, particularly in regions with weaker labour protections, where exploitative practices and poor working conditions are prevalent. High standards in the European Union support auditing and certification frameworks to ensure compliance with strict labour regulations and environmental policies, promoting fair treatment, safe working environments, and efforts to reduce toxic chemical use. Our European leather partner lead the way in mitigating these risks, as evidenced by the Leather Working Group Gold certification.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: While soft furnishing PVC materials offer durability, versatility and longevity, they require management to reduce risks throughout their lifecycle. Instyle's manufacturer is REACH, RoHS + Bluesign compliant, however vinyls can still produce harmful emissions during manufacturing. Instyle is working on developing responsible recirculation pathways through our REVIVE product stewardship scheme to help mitigate potential environmental impacts at end-of-life.
specific_installation_methods: Avoiding any direct adhesive application to backing foam makes leathers more suitable for end-of-life stewardship. Ideally, leathers should be reused as part of the original furnishing structure to maximise their lifespan and sustainability.
other_comments: Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

compliance_requirements.rating: Ignitability 11, Flame Spread 0, Heat Evolved 3, Smoke Developed 6

type_of_packaging: Our circular packaging strategy for leathers uses high percentage recycled cardboard, reusable pallets, and recycled paper. We continuously reduce polymer use, currently limited only to tapes and necessary bagging where no viable sustainable alternative exists.

The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_action_plan_comment: Communicating directly with the supplier to establish Corrective Action Plans that focused on implementing processes and procedures, retraining staff, and establishing policies so that all risks, low to high, can be monitored, responded to and eliminated.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks are major concerns in global leather supply chains, particularly in regions with weaker labour protections, where exploitative practices and poor working conditions are prevalent. High standards in the European Union support auditing and certification frameworks to ensure compliance with strict labour regulations and environmental policies, promoting fair treatment, safe working environments, and efforts to reduce toxic chemical use. Our European leather partner lead the way in mitigating these risks, as evidenced by the Leather Working Group Gold certification.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: While soft furnishing PVC materials offer durability, versatility and longevity, they require management to reduce risks throughout their lifecycle. Instyle's manufacturer is REACH, RoHS + Bluesign compliant, however vinyls can still produce harmful emissions during manufacturing. Instyle is working on developing responsible recirculation pathways through our REVIVE product stewardship scheme to help mitigate potential environmental impacts at end-of-life.
specific_installation_methods: Avoiding any direct adhesive application to backing foam makes leathers more suitable for end-of-life stewardship. Ideally, leathers should be reused as part of the original furnishing structure to maximise their lifespan and sustainability.
other_comments: Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

type_of_packaging: Our circular packaging strategy for leathers uses high percentage recycled cardboard, reusable pallets, and recycled paper. We continuously reduce polymer use, currently limited only to tapes and necessary bagging where no viable sustainable alternative exists.

product_description: An easy-to-install acoustic tile with an award-winning timeless design & quality sound absorption

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems

recyclable_percentage_description: Ecoustic wall tiles can be recycled through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme either on-site or through one of our local third-party recycling partners: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: Ecoustic wall tiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recycling_process_description: 100% PET (polyethylene terephthalate) is a mono-material that can be mechanically recycled into pellets or flakes for use in textiles, carpets, and nonwoven materials, or moulded into containers and packaging strapping. It can also be chemically recycled and repolymerised into food-grade PET resin for bottles, containers, or high-quality textile fibres comparable to virgin PET. Australia currently lacks commercial-scale chemical reprocessing facilities for plastics, however, so most PET is downcycled into lower-grade composite materials (e.g. foam).
reusable_description: Ecoustic wall tiles are designed for easy, quick installation + disassembly, and can be reused as they do not require adhesive or permanent fixtures. Tiles are mounted to a surface using a 4-way screw-in joiner clip. This allows for easy separation of materials at end of product lifecycle.
end_of_life_program_description: Ecoustic wall tiles can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Water is not used in the manufacturing of this product.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Local manufacturing, consolidated shipments, efficient packing and optimised routes are all employed to reduce emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: Waste, environmental impact and cost can be minimised by designing with tile size in mind. Refer to the brochure for assembly guidance, ensure to provide a plan for installation, and contact the Instyle Ecoustic team for CAD drawings.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights risks in PET supply chains arise mainly in the polymer processing stage, where workers can be exposed to harmful VOCs and antimony, a toxic substance used as a catalyst. These conditions necessitate stringent safety measures to protect workers' health and rights. These risks are minimised due to strict Australia labour laws, and as qualified by the product's Declare and Global Greentag Level A certifications.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Acoustic PET panels can release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. This can be mitigated by returning the product to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
specific_installation_methods: Ecoustic wall tiles are designed for easy, quick installation + disassembly, and can be reused as they do not require adhesive or permanent fixtures. Tiles are mounted to a surface using a 4-way screw-in joiner clip. This allows for easy separation of materials at end of product lifecycle. Follow the accompanying installation + care guides for installation guidelines that maximise product longevity.
other_comments: Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

modern_slavery_comments: Human rights risks in PET supply chains arise mainly in the polymer processing stage, where workers can be exposed to harmful VOCs and antimony, a toxic substance used as a catalyst. These conditions necessitate stringent safety measures to protect workers' health and rights. These risks are minimised due to strict Australia labour laws, and as qualified by the product's Declare and Global Greentag Level A certifications.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Acoustic PET panels can release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. This can be mitigated by returning the product to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
specific_installation_methods: Ecoustic wall tiles are designed for easy, quick installation + disassembly, and can be reused as they do not require adhesive or permanent fixtures. Tiles are mounted to a surface using a 4-way screw-in joiner clip. This allows for easy separation of materials at end of product lifecycle. Follow the accompanying installation + care guides for installation guidelines that maximise product longevity.
other_comments: Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

recycling_process_description: 100% PET (polyethylene terephthalate) is a mono-material that can be mechanically recycled into pellets or flakes for use in textiles, carpets, and nonwoven materials, or moulded into containers and packaging strapping. It can also be chemically recycled and repolymerised into food-grade PET resin for bottles, containers, or high-quality textile fibres comparable to virgin PET. Australia currently lacks commercial-scale chemical reprocessing facilities for plastics, however, so most PET is downcycled into lower-grade composite materials (e.g. foam).

recyclable_percentage_description: Being investigated
recyclable_offcuts_description: Staron Solid Surfaces has minimal offcuts compared to many other surfacing products due to the seamless joining capabilities. We have implemented spec sheets for our fabricators so they can make samples from waste. These are used for our displays and to offer designers to assist colour selections. They are also gifted to customers for use as breadboards/cheese platters. And given to people for DIY crafts and small projects.
recycled_content_description: This is pre consumer content and reflects manufacturing processes to minimise waste and should not be confused with post-consumer recycled content.
recycling_process_description: It can be renewed and repaired insitu minimising the need to deconstruct. Alternatively, Staron can be removed and redesigned into new applications. Also, it can be used in other ways, as an alternative to other building materials such as: skirty and kicks as an example.
reusable_description: yes, Staron can be upcycled, reused, renewed, repaired at the projects end of life and implemented into other applications/projects.
water_reduction_techniques: yes
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: we outsource our deliveries or customers collect therefore this information cannot be answered properly.
minimisation_design_strategy: –Manufactured with a special technic means two pieces become one, maximising product yield and minimising offcuts and wastage. Offcuts are also used to reinforce joins for other applications reducing waste.  Alternatively designing to sheet sizes can also assist.
factory_finished_description: yes product is sanded
applied_finish_required_description: Final sanding after fabrication
other_comments: We have introduced strategies to support those interested in upcycling Staron for DIY projects.

recyclable_percentage_description: Ecoustic U Groove can be recycled through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme either on-site or through one of our local third-party recycling partners: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: Ecoustic U Groove offcuts can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recycled_content_description: SCS Certified 60% Post-Consumer Recycled Polyester Staple Fiber Content
recycling_process_description: 100% PET (polyethylene terephthalate) is a mono-material that can be mechanically recycled into pellets or flakes for use in textiles, carpets, and nonwoven materials, or moulded into containers and packaging strapping. It can also be chemically recycled and repolymerised into food-grade PET resin for bottles, containers, or high-quality textile fibres comparable to virgin PET. Australia currently lacks commercial-scale chemical reprocessing facilities for plastics, however, so most PET is downcycled into lower-grade composite materials (e.g. foam).
reusable_description: Ecoustic U Groove is designed for improved dematerialisation. Our panels can be installed using Instyle’s intuitive natural anodised aluminium edging profiles, which reduce the need for excess adhesive and allow for easier separation of materials at end of product lifecycle.
end_of_life_program_description: Ecoustic U Groove can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Water is not used in the manufacturing of this product.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Consolidated shipments, efficient packing and optimised routes are all employed to reduce emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: Waste, environmental impact and cost can be minimised by designing with panel size in mind. The Instyle Ecoustic design team can help with efficient yield component sizes for our panel products.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights risks in PET supply chains arise mainly in the polymer processing stage, where workers can be exposed to harmful VOCs and antimony, a toxic substance used as a catalyst. These conditions necessitate stringent safety measures to protect workers' health and rights. All of Instyle's Ecoustic SC products are free of such risks, as qualified by their Declare and Cradle to Cradle certifications.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Acoustic PET panels can release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. This can be mitigated by returning the product to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
specific_installation_methods: Ecoustic U Groove is designed for improved dematerialisation. Our panels can be installed using Instyle’s intuitive natural anodised aluminium edging profiles, which reduce the need for excess adhesive and allow for easier separation of materials at end of product lifecycle. Follow the accompanying installation + care guides for installation guidelines that maximise product longevity.
other_comments: Please note that kgCO2eq value varies depending panel thicknesses – an average has been provided. Refer to EPD for full breakdown. Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.
type_of_packaging: Our circular packaging strategy for Ecoustic products uses 84% recycled cardboard, reusable pallets, and recycled paper. We continuously reduce polymer use, currently limited only to tapes and necessary bagging where no viable sustainable alternative exists.

end_of_life_program_description:
Products reach the end of their product life cycle for several reasons. Decor Systems recognises that end-of-life milestones are often key to maintaining environmental sustainability initiatives.

With that in mind, we have set out below our End of Product Lifecycle Policy which aims to dually maintain the ongoing sustainability of our products and simultaneously support school facilities in areas that are designated in lower socio-economic regions.

If our acoustic panel systems attain their end of life due to building demolition or refurbishment, Decor Systems commits to donating usable panels to educational facilities (schools, training centres, childcare, etc.) in regions identified as having a high proportion of students with learning challenges.

Special consideration is given to centres that focus on literacy programs for Indigenous students.

The following conditions apply:

Liaise with Decor Systems to determine suitability before panels are returned. Photos will be required both before and after dismantling to ascertain suitability.
Panels to be dismantled and returned to Decor Systems at the client’s cost.
Panels must be in reasonable condition in their original manufactured sizes.
The final decision will rest with Decor Systems as to the suitability of the panels for re-deployment to alternative projects.
minimisation_design_strategy: Decor Systems offers free shop drawings to ensure accurate site measurement and minimal wastage. We also offer a site measurement service using the latest technology for added accuracy.
modern_slavery_comments:
Decor Systems is committed to ethical business practices and the eradication of modern slavery in all its forms. We firmly believe in upholding human rights, promoting social responsibility, and maintaining transparency in our operations and supply chains. This Modern Slavery Statement outlines our approach to combating modern slavery and human trafficking, the steps we have taken to prevent its occurrence, and our plans for continuous improvement.

INTRODUCTION
This is the second Modern Slavery Statement submitted by Decor Systems. Decor Systems has elected to publish this statement voluntarily, as informed by the Modern Slavery Act 2018.

The purpose of this statement is to outline the business’ systems for identifying the risk of modern slavery in our operations and supply chain and implementing processes to minimise any risk.

Decor Systems recognise that slavery and human trafficking can occur in many forms including forced labour, child labour, human trafficking, forced marriage and deceptive methods of recruiting labour.

Decor Systems are committed to operating responsibly and maintaining ethical standards across our operations, with a particular focus on risk areas within our supply chain.

STRUCTURE
Decor Systems is a family owned Australian owned and operated vertically integrated manufacturer, supplier and retailer of architectural acoustic panel systems.

Our headquarters, manufacturing and supply facility located in Glendenning, NSW. Decor Systems maintains offices in Brisbane and Melbourne.

OPERATIONS AND SUPPLY CHAINS
Decor Systems is committed to the superior design, production and supply of quality products and services. We have been in the business for over 50 years and offer an extensive range of innovative products, professional services, experience, and industry knowledge.

With a growing team of Sales and Project Consultants located throughout Australia, , a modern manufacturing and supply facility and an international sourcing team, Decor Systems has a valued reputation for reliably delivering state-of-the-art architectural solutions.

Decor Systems’ supply chain includes both local and overseas suppliers with whom the business has established, long-standing supply agreements in place.

Our manufacturing facility produces custom and made-to-order products, sourcing raw materials and componentry from tier one suppliers mostly located in Australia.

Our importing division sources and assembles materials that requires little or no customisation, with raw materials sourced largely from suppliers located in Germany, USA and Latvia, as well as some local Australian suppliers.

ADDRESSING THE RISK OF MODERN SLAVERY PRACTICES
The Decor Systems executive team are committed to ethical procurement and oppose slavery in all its forms.

Policies and risk management processes have been implemented to identify and address the risk of modern slavery in our supply chain. This includes routine supplier evaluation and supply chain mapping that encompasses a range of environmental and ethical risks, including modern slavery.

Within this supply chain analysis, BFX has identified two areas of risk. First, a generally low risk of modern slavery in the construction supplies sector. Second, some second-tier suppliers where materials are imported from overseas have a medium geographic and entity risk.

DUE DILIGENCE AND REMEDIATION PROCESSES
To date, Decor Systems has had no reported incidents of modern slavery or breaches by its overseas suppliers.

Nevertheless, Decor Systems recognises the inherent risk of slavery and human trafficking within the supply chain and has established internal processes to guide supplier selection and tendering, including:

Consideration of certain factors before a supplier is awarded a supply contract. For example, the potential supplier’s reputation, ability to supply, integrity, financial strength and compliance with legislation and best practice.
Ensuring that Decor Systems do not purchase materials from suppliers that breach the UN Guiding Principles. If any existing suppliers are found to have breached the UN Guiding Principles, Decor Systems will take immediate steps to reassess those supply arrangements.
Staff training within Decor Systems direct supply chain,in which supplier evaluation is conducted prior to engagement of suppliers.
Existing suppliers are audited in line with Decor Systems GECA, FSC and Illegal Logging Audit requirements.
FUTURE COMMITMENTS
Over the next year, Decor Systems focus areas will be:

Further refining our procurement processes and training our procurement team with best practice initiatives.
Reviewing identified risk areas in the supply chain and reporting to the Decor Systems board.
David Faulkes
Chief Executive Officer

recyclable_percentage_description: Onshore recycling facility installed at local Manufacturing plants.
recyclable_offcuts_description: The manufacturing of particleboard utilises recycled wood and off cuts in the production of new particleboard at Oberon facility. Offcuts of MDF is used for packing material and gluts.
recycling_process_description:
reDirect Wood Recycling has been established to provide a closed loop particleboard and wood recycling service. By installing a reDirect Recycling service you will enjoy significant cost savings in landfill charges.
The reDirect Wood Recovery Initiative has been designed to service polytec customers who are buying raw and melamine coated particleboard products. reDirect Wood Recycling will reclaim materials that would otherwise go to landfill, thereby reducing waste, preserving plantation pine forests and protecting the environment for future generations. The manufacturing of particleboard utilises recycled wood and off cuts in the production of new particleboard. By opting for wood off cut collection through reDirect Recycling you are assisting in creating sustainable manufacturing practices.
reusable_description: The entire product with edging or laminate can be recycled or repurposed.
end_of_life_program_description:
reDirect Wood Recycling has been established to provide a closed loop particleboard and wood recycling service. By installing a reDirect Recycling service you will enjoy significant cost savings in landfill charges.
The reDirect Wood Recovery Initiative has been designed to service polytec customers who are buying raw and melamine coated particleboard products. reDirect Wood Recycling will reclaim materials that would otherwise go to landfill, thereby reducing waste, preserving plantation pine forests and protecting the environment for future generations. The manufacturing of particleboard utilises recycled wood and off cuts in the production of new particleboard. By opting for wood off cut collection through reDirect Recycling you are assisting in creating sustainable manufacturing practices.
water_reduction_techniques:
polytec’s main source of water comes from our Waste Water Treatment Plant (WWTP). Community
town water is used only to supplement that which is consumed as recycled and softened water.
The WWTP treats effluent to a tertiary treatment level through Ultra filtration (UF) and Reverse
Osmosis (RO) and returned to the MDF facility as softened water for use in the boilers and or
manufacturing process. Approximately 2/3 of our Oberon Manufacturing facility daily water
requirement is supplied by our WWTP.
With the exception of a portion of the HPP site, the WWTP manages all the wastewater and
stormwater from the surrounding sites at the Oberon Timber Complex (OTC).
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Australian Owned/Australian Made local manufacturing
minimisation_design_strategy: Designing to the sheet sizes and try to optimise the sheet to its maximum.

recyclable_offcuts_description: Remember during onsite installation the product has been designed for no offcuts, as all optimisations completed at manufacture in Australia step with the size of the panels. During manufacturing, offcuts is used for packing material and gluts, and can be used in energy recovery.
reusable_description: The entire product can be demounted for reuse or energy recovery.
water_reduction_techniques:
polytec’s main source of water comes from our Waste Water Treatment Plant (WWTP). Community
town water is used only to supplement that which is consumed as recycled and softened water.
The WWTP treats effluent to a tertiary treatment level through Ultra filtration (UF) and Reverse
Osmosis (RO) and returned to the MDF facility as softened water for use in the boilers and or
manufacturing process. Approximately 2/3 of our Oberon Manufacturing facility daily water
requirement is supplied by our WWTP.
With the exception of a portion of the HPP site, the WWTP manages all the wastewater and
stormwater from the surrounding sites at the Oberon Timber Complex (OTC).
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Australian Owned/Australian Made local manufacturing
minimisation_design_strategy: The whole design of Easycraft Contours enables almost no onsite waste as products are sizes designed for install areas ready to put in with minimal additional resources and quicker time.
modern_slavery_comments: https://modernslaveryregister.gov.au/statements/cuZyaGcaV1z5o3r/pdf/
